newsitem.title: USA: Evans Systems adopts restructuring plan.
newsitem.headline: Evans Systems adopts restructuring plan.

text.p: Evans Systems Inc said on Wednesday that it had initiated a restructuring plan that called for a 10 percent reduction in staff at two of its units and the sale of 25 percent of its retail outlets.
The company also anticipated a fiscal loss for 1997 due to lower sales by its ChemWay business coupled with tighter gasoline margins in its retail outlets.

Specifically, the plan recommended a 10 percent reduction in management and staff at ChemWay and EDCO Environmental, a move expected to result in savings of roughly $220,000 within the next 12 months.
Also outlined in the plan was the sale or lease of 25 percent of the company's operating Convenience Stores.
In a statement, the company also said it received preliminary approval to increase its credit facility with Texas Commerce Bank by $3.5 million to $10.2 million.
Evans Systems Inc produces automotive chemical products, distributes petroleum products and owns a chain of retail outlets.
